author: John Jurgensen
title: How Do ‘American Idol’ Winners Fare in the Music Industry?
text:
The new rendition of “American Idol” is being judged primarily on the ratings and buzz it generates for ABC. But can the show, whose 16th-season premiere over the weekend drew 10.3 million viewers, still make good on its stated mission to catapult singers into music-industry stardom?

Based on sales by winners of “Idol” and other music-competition shows in recent years, the launch platform seems shaky. The genre’s most successful acts, including Carrie Underwood and Kelly Clarkson (now a judge on NBC’s rival series “The Voice”),... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
